short_summary: Rehabilitation of Dike B8-18, Chambly Canal National Historic Site
full_summary:
**Rehabilitation of Dike B8-18, Chambly Canal National Historic Site**

**Call Reference:** 5P468-22-0101/A
**Posting Date:** September 1, 2022
**Closing Date and Time:** September 23, 2022, 14:00 MST

**Objective and Scope:**

Parks Canada invites bids for the rehabilitation of an embankment dike, approximately 110 meters in length. The project involves:

* Clearing and removal of trees and existing natural features
* Installation of geotextiles, compacted impermeable materials, granular material, riprap, topsoil, and grass
* Construction of temporary fill cofferdams, access roads, and ramps
* Removal and site rehabilitation of temporary fill cofferdams

The dike is located in Carignan, Quebec, between bridge number 7 and bridge number 9, on the right bank of the Chambly Canal.

**Bid Requirements:**

* Bidders must submit their bids electronically via email to soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca. Faxed or mailed bids will not be accepted.
* Bidders should be aware of the maximum email file size (15 megabytes) and not exceed it.
* Bidders are responsible for any failure attributable to the transmission or receipt of the emailed bid due to file size.

**Project Timeline:**

* Bidders should plan to complete the project by March 31, 2023.

**Site Visit:**

* A site visit is recommended for bidders to inspect the work site.
* The site visit will be held on September 9, 2022, at 10:00 AM (local time).

**Submittals:**

* Bidders must submit their bids electronically via email.
* Bidders are responsible for any failure attributable to the transmission or receipt of the emailed bid due to file size.

**Meetings and Correspondence:**

* All enquiries of a technical and contractual nature must be submitted to Parks Canada.
* Enquiries must be submitted in writing and received by Parks Canada at least five business days prior to the closing date to allow sufficient time to provide a response.

**Pre-Bid Conference:**

* A pre-bid conference is not required.

**Special Requirement:**

* Parks Canada requires that all work is performed in accordance with the National Park Act.
